message.content:
cs.LG, cs.ST, cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.NA

The paper deals with the problem of identifying linear relations among variables based on noisy measurements, which is a fundamental problem in machine learning and statistics. The paper discusses various topics such as errors-in-variables, factor analysis, and instrumental variables, which are all related to the problem of how to account for the anticipated way that noise enters in the data. These topics are typically studied in the sub-fields of machine learning, statistics, and information theory, which suggest that the paper could belong to the following sub-categories: cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.ST (Statistics), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis). Among these sub-categories, cs.LG and cs.ST are the most likely ones, as the paper deals with fundamental problems in machine learning and statistics.
